paragraphs.content: Chapter 2
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 2

paragraphs.content: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,
paragraphs.contentHtml: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,

paragraphs.content: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.

paragraphs.content: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

paragraphs.content: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

paragraphs.content: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

paragraphs.content: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

paragraphs.content: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:
paragraphs.contentHtml: But made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

paragraphs.content: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

paragraphs.content: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;
paragraphs.contentHtml: That at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;

paragraphs.content: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

paragraphs.content: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.

paragraphs.content: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

paragraphs.content: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;
paragraphs.contentHtml: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;

paragraphs.content: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Holding forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.

paragraphs.content: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.

paragraphs.content: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

paragraphs.content: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timotheus shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

paragraphs.content: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.

paragraphs.content: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ’s.

paragraphs.content: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.

paragraphs.content: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

paragraphs.content: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

paragraphs.content: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.

paragraphs.content: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.

paragraphs.content: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.

paragraphs.content: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

paragraphs.content: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

paragraphs.content: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.
